questions.questionText: In a figure series, a square with a diagonal line from top-left to bottom-right is followed by the same square with the line from top-right to bottom-left. What comes next if the pattern continues?
questions.explanation: The diagonal line is rotating 90Â° clockwise each time. After top-left to bottom-right, then top-right to bottom-left, the next position is bottom-right to top-left. But continuing the rotation, it returns to top-left to bottom-right. The pattern alternates, so option 1 is correct.

questions.questionText: A figure series shows: 1st figure has 2 dots, 2nd has 4 dots, 3rd has 6 dots, 4th has 8 dots. How many dots will the 5th figure have?
questions.explanation: The pattern adds 2 dots with each figure: 2, 4, 6, 8. Following this pattern, the 5th figure will have 8 + 2 = 10 dots.

questions.questionText: A figure series shows: Triangle (3 sides), Square (4 sides), Pentagon (5 sides), Hexagon (6 sides). What shape comes next?
questions.explanation: The pattern shows polygons with an increasing number of sides: 3, 4, 5, 6. The next shape should have 7 sides, which is a heptagon.
